actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Res. 240.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Mast moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended. H. Res. 240 — "Condemning recent actions taken by the Russian military to down a United States Air Force drone."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1151.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Mast moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 1151 — "To hold the People's Republic of China accountable for the violation of United States airspace and sovereignty with its high-altitude surveillance balloon."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1149.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Mast moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 1149 — "To establish certain reporting and other requirements relating to telecommunications equipment and services produced or provided by certain entities, and for other purposes."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.

Mr. Mast asked unanimous consent That it may be in order at any time on Thursday, April 27, 2023, for the Speaker to declare a recess, subject to the call of the Chair, for the purpose of receiving in joint meeting His Excellency Yoon Suk Yeol, President of the Republic of Korea. Agreed to without objection.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of April 17.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.

actions-list.header: United States Group of the NATO Parliamentary Assembly
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to 22 U.S.C. 1928a, and the order of the House of January 9, 2023, the Speaker appointed the following members of the House to the United States Group of the NATO Parliamentary Assembly: Mr. Connolly, Ms. Sanchez, Mr. Larsen of Washington and Mr. Boyle of Pennsylvania.

Pursuant to section 2 of the Migratory Bird Conservation Act (16 U.S.C. 715a), and the order of the House of January 9, 2023, the Speaker appointed the following member of the House to the Migratory Bird Conservation Commission: Mr. Thompson of California.

actions-list.header: Commission on Security and Cooperation in Europe
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to 22 U.S.C 3003, and the order of the House of January 9, 2023, the Speaker appointed the following members of the House to the Commission on Security and Cooperation in Europe: Mr. Cohen, Mr. Cleaver and Mr. Veasey.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches.
The Chair designated Ms. Salinas to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.

The Chair announced that he had examined the Journal of the last day's proceedings and had approved it. Mr. Wilson (SC) demanded that the question be put on agreeing to the Speaker's approval of the Journal and by voice vote, the Chair announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Wilson (SC) objected to the voice vote based upon the absence of a quorum and the Chair postponed further proceedings on the question of agreeing to the Speaker's approval of the Journal until a time to be announced.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
